content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

1. Here's the code to create a function `add_yearmonth`:
```julia-repl
# Import Pkg. DataFrames package
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    # Add new column "ym" to df by extracting year and month from dt using DateFormat("yyyymm")
    transform!(df, :dt => (dt -> Dates.format.(dt, "yyyymm")) => :ym; renamecols=true)
end
```
2. Now you can call `add_yearmonth` on your DataFrame `df`. Make sure to replace the variable name with your actual one if it's different:
```julia-repl
# Call add_yearmonth function on df
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This code will create a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` in `yyyymm` format.
